Layer¶

class clumpy.definition.LandUseCoverLayer(name=None, scale=1, time=0, path=None, sound=1)¶

Bases: clumpy.definition._layer._Layer

Defines a Land Use Cover (LUC) layer. This layer can then used for the calibration stage or the allocation stage:

luc1998 = clumpy.definition.layer.LayerLUC(name='LUC-1998',scale=15,time=0)
Parameters

  • name (string, optional) – the map name

  • scale (float) – the pixel side real length in meters

  • time (time) – the map time

export_asc(path)¶

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

export_tiff(path, mode=None)¶

Export the layer data as a tif or a tiff file. The file extension can be something else than tiff. See Image Pillow documentation, Image.save.

using mode=”I” is required by Dinamica for LUC maps.

Parameters

path (str) – output file path

import_numpy(data, sound=1)¶

Set the layer data by importing a numpy matrix.

Parameters

data (numpy array) – the data

import_tiff(path, sound=1)¶

Imports the layer data from a tif or a tiff file. The file extension can be something else than tiff. See Image Pillow documentation, Image.open.

Parameters

path (str) – path to the file

class clumpy.definition.FeatureLayer(name=None, scale=1, time=0, path=None)¶

Bases: clumpy.definition._layer._Layer

Defines an Explanatory Variable (EV) layer. This layer can then used for the calibration stage or the allocation stage:

elevation = clumpy.definition.layer.LayerEV(name='elevation',time=0,scale=15)
Parameters

  • name (string, optional) – the map name

  • scale (float) – the pixel side real length in meters

  • time (time) – the map time

export_asc(path)¶

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

export_tiff(path, mode=None)¶

Export the layer data as a tif or a tiff file. The file extension can be something else than tiff. See Image Pillow documentation, Image.save.

using mode=”I” is required by Dinamica for LUC maps.

Parameters

path (str) – output file path

import_numpy(data, sound=1)¶

Set the layer data by importing a numpy matrix.

Parameters

data (numpy array) – the data

import_tiff(path)¶

Imports the layer data from a tif or a tiff file. The file extension can be something else than tiff. See Image Pillow documentation, Image.open.

Parameters

path (str) – path to the file

class clumpy.definition.DistanceToVFeatureLayer(v, layer_LUC, name=None)¶

Bases: clumpy.definition._layer.FeatureLayer

Defines a distance to a state as a layer. This layer can then used for the calibration stage or the allocation stage:

distance_to_2 = clumpy.definition.layer.LayerEV(name='elevation',time=0,scale=15)

However, it is recommended to prefer the case’s method clumpy.definition.Case.add_distance_to_v_as_feature.

Parameters

  • v (int) – The state to compute the distance from.

  • layer_LUC (LandUseCoverLayer) – The land use cover used to compute the distance.

  • name (string (default=``None``)) – The layer name. If none, name is defined as 'distance_to_v_'+str(v).

export_asc(path)¶

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

export_tiff(path, mode=None)¶

Export the layer data as a tif or a tiff file. The file extension can be something else than tiff. See Image Pillow documentation, Image.save.

using mode=”I” is required by Dinamica for LUC maps.

Parameters

path (str) – output file path

import_numpy(data, sound=1)¶

Set the layer data by importing a numpy matrix.

Parameters

data (numpy array) – the data

import_tiff(path)¶

Imports the layer data from a tif or a tiff file. The file extension can be something else than tiff. See Image Pillow documentation, Image.open.

Parameters

path (str) – path to the file
